column5: Thank god.

You would benefit greatly by seeing a psychiatrist. Not a counselor, but a doctor that specializes in issues like these, or a diagnostician.  I think it would help you to not have to question yourself anymore?  If you are able to, seek out the best of the best.  These traits in you are a little more serious than your ‚Äúgarden variety mental disorders‚Äù, (no haters now, it was a joke).   In the meantime take care of yourself physically and mentally!

Take care ‚ù§Ô∏è

We all have to be patient. Patience separates the good and the bad that we get out of life. Do you think any woman wants to be with a man who rages like you!?  Be patient and she will find her way to you. You will have a normal, loving relationship and forget these thoughts ever happened.
I have to say..,, I whole heartedly agree. People suck.
You‚Äôre welcome. I have been there.... too much.

You have to step outside the box and look in. Reevaluate. Realize that the situations surrounding your feelings will be of zero importance in 6 months or less. You matter kiddo. You matter to me, you matter to this world. If you weren‚Äôt in it, everything would be different. Each thought you have and each movement you make matters. The hardest thing you will EVER have to do is stay alive when you feel like dying. You can do this. 

‚ù§Ô∏è
Thank you so much!

I can‚Äôt find a dr that will prescribe them to me.  At least not here in Alaska. It‚Äôs become this terrible thing to prescribe because people are misusing it. I can see that with Valium or Xanax but Klonopin seems more ‚Äúclinical‚Äù if you know what I mean.  It‚Äôs still a benzo tho. I‚Äôve even thought about ordering some from Canada lol. I totally know what you mean by not wanting to be a slave to it!  I wonder if there‚Äôs any research done regarding super duper long-term use. I‚Äôll have to look into that. 

160 to 180 mg a day. I have to admit I‚Äôve been there. üòè. I use to own a pub in Oregon and after they took me off the Klonopin, I picked that addiction up (yay me!). Usually vicodin, but I had a couple people who would come in daily and drink all night and pay me with pills. I had zero excuse. I had no pain other than my brain pain from not having the Klonopin. I used suboxone to taper myself off of that. And yes it was very uncomfortable, but for for me anyway, not as horrific as Klonopin.   Then again OxyContin is like 30% stronger!  That must‚Äôve been HELL for you!  Wtf was that doctor thinking!!  I can‚Äôt believe you were prescribed that much!  And why didn‚Äôt they offer you suboxone?

In the end I sold the bar and with a signature in the wrong place, I lost any gain from it financially.  SO I was left with legit PTSD from the withdrawal, no money, the aftermath of the pain med addiction AND the horror of finding out that my bf of 8 years, and the father of my twins, had been to jail in his past for rape. I was unable to cope with all this and had a nervous breakdown which is NOT fun. I‚Äôm not saying that Klonopin was the cause of it, but I know for a fact things would‚Äôve turned out differently and I could‚Äôve handled the extreme stress.  I literally went into the doc begging for help in tears (he had a med student mirroring him) and all he said was he couldn‚Äôt help me. 

Omg I‚Äôm talking about myself too much. I‚Äôm sorry. 

Just make sure they taper. I‚Äôm talking maybe even 1-2 years!  At least you‚Äôd have a goal!  There‚Äôs no reason to be in discomfort when you don‚Äôt have to be. Doctors don‚Äôt know shit about addiction or mental health issues unless they are trained in that area. Tell them what you want and don‚Äôt let them give you otherwise. It‚Äôs your health and your mind not theirs.  

May I ask what caused so much back pain?

Have you found anything in your research explaining what could be the cause of your agoraphobia and panic attacks?

I was on Klonopin for 6 1/2 years. I started off with .5 mg a day and that‚Äôs all I ever needed and never asked to up the meds. This medicine changed my whole life. I was able to talk to people, socialize, be successful, etc. After I got off of it, everything went back to the way it was before and my life is shit.  A Dr. decided one day that I shouldn‚Äôt be taking them, apparently after benzos became a popular topic, and took me off too quickly. He halved the dose the next day for two weeks and then nothing. I cannot explain in words the utter turmoil and debilitating withdrawals I went through. This lasted for three weeks and it was pure hell. I should‚Äôve been in the hospital. I wanted to end my life so bad but I couldn‚Äôt because of my kids mostly and the physical condition I was in.  Tremors, massive anxiety, depression, unable to sleep, a feeling of screaming for something, anything, anyone to please help. Omg it SUCKED!!!  That was just the beginning. I don‚Äôt mean to scare you, I‚Äôm just saying how important it is to go on a proper taper schedule. I think 3/4 of my symptoms could‚Äôve been avoided had I gone to the ER. I probably could‚Äôve gotten some help but at that point I had zero trust in doctors and I refused to go in and be treated like an addict.  I literally thought they would intentionally make me worse. 

Now, would I start taking them again?  Yes. I live a really hard existence. It‚Äôs a daily struggle just to talk to anyone and therefor I‚Äôm just.... alone. That‚Äôs no way to live. 

The long-term affects from Klonopin I think for me, which could be completely different from others, is memory loss, like really bad.  But I drank for a long time and that most certainly didn‚Äôt help. I have talked to others on a forum and their symptoms have been more physical like tics and muscle spasms. 

I wonder If staying on the drug would be beneficial as a lifetime ritual? Some people have to take medicine all their life just to stay alive, why can‚Äôt people take something that helps with their mental state that is ongoing and debilitating to your happiness and well-being?

Sorry for the long answer and life story lol. I think what I‚Äôm saying is TAPER properly and possibly find an anti-depressant and anti-anxiety med that will help.  Maybe Buspar and Venlafaxine?  Just a suggestion. 

I hope SO MUCH you feel better soon. 

Be happy.
Do you use something else besides the organic, raw veggies to balance the tummy?  Do you start with a raw diet completely to kick it off?

Good answer!  I googled Lions Mane after reading this and am buying some today!

[Lion‚Äôs Mane](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.jafc.5b02914)
What he said!  Psychedelics are going to be used as medicine someday.

You are no different from other people!  Maybe you like stuff that‚Äôs not necessarily considered ‚Äúaverage‚Äù but if it‚Äôs on the porn site, there‚Äôs tons of other people watching it as well!  As long as you don‚Äôt act out anything without clear boundaries set between you and your significant other then you‚Äôre good!  Now how your girl might react is a different story. Some women just straight up think it‚Äôs a sin to watch porn. They get jealous and it becomes an issue, yada yada.  We can be so uptight but I think for the most part most women these days are petty open. Oh, and we are probably watching the same stuff too :). Everyone has secrets!
Did the new psychiatrists you saw suggest any medications?  How come they couldn‚Äôt provide you with a diagnosis?

I think you should ask her out. I would find a way to bump into her more often and do this; (I‚Äôm not kidding!) ... be kind of a dick. Be confident too, so a confident dick lol. Girls are so weird that way. The more you seem unattainable, the more she will want you I guarantee it.   You have an old soul (it‚Äôs a good thing) and if she is mature, smart and a good person, she will see that. 

If it doesn‚Äôt work out at least you can move on and not waste your time obsessing about it anymore!  There‚Äôs millions of different personalities. People with their own dreams and futures and morals and world views etc...to learn about! 

The anxiety you feel is completely legit. It sounds like you‚Äôre having panic attacks.  There‚Äôs too much pressure on you guys nowadays. Social bullshit in high school is something you couldn‚Äôt pay me to repeat. Def see a doctor if it gets worse cause there is very helpful medication for that!

Be happy!

I completely get that. All I‚Äôm ever met with is confused looks and quick topic changers. For me I just go outside, usually by myself, and take pics of stuff. It‚Äôs a way for my mind to be kind of occupied instead of thinking bad thoughts all the time. 

I do very much understand what you‚Äôre going through. I am SO sorry to think that you are feeling anything like I do. 

You are not alone!  üíï

You have ruled out all personality disorders?  Have you suffered abuse?  I have this same problem so I‚Äôm interested in what you find out. I have had a lot of trauma in my life so I have learned to mentally ‚Äúshut down‚Äù so I wonder if it‚Äôs bleeding over into my regular memories and thought processes. Another reason for me might be because I took Clonopin for 6 years and was taken off of it carelessly. The outcome of that was terrible, horrible withdraw that lasted a month and caused PTSD and then brought me right back to the life I had before I started taking it which was shit. Another suggestion is to get another MRI and a second opinion?

I hope you find out a solution! 

Be happy!

It sounds like you know exactly what to do. Finish that degree and then reassess how you feel. I bet you things will turn around for you and you will have a new outlook on life. 

Do you love your boyfriend? Your parents? Then don‚Äôt commit suicide because you‚Äôll ruin their lives.  If you don‚Äôt feel the self-love for you right now, think about them. Depression takes a lot out of you, believe me I know. But to start, take a walk  and try not to notice anything except for things that are caused naturally. Birds, wind, etc.. See if you can focus on that for five minutes and maybe tomorrow ten minutes. I care so if you want someone to talk to I‚Äôm here. 

Be happy!  Xo

Hi there. I suffer from the same thing. I have finally, at age 47, found a best friend that I connect with. Every other friend I‚Äôve had has always stabbed me in the back or we‚Äôre just not someone I could open up to. I have really bad social anxiety so that doesn‚Äôt help. This is true in ALL of my relationships including my family. I feel uncomfortable around everyone. I am always wondering exactly what they‚Äôre thinking or what they‚Äôre capable of doing. I have found that most people are NOT good people. As for relationships, I‚Äôm alone and feel I always will be.  I attract really toxic men and it‚Äôs just so scary at this point that I have given up and am really fucking sad about it.  

I think one thing I would do differently is shove myself into situations that I‚Äôm scared of. Make myself go out or make myself seek help. I k ow the more I do these things the most comfortable I feel. I‚Äôve given up on me but you can do it!  Have you ever taken a Meyers Briggs personality test?  It‚Äôs kinda cool. I am an INFP which is only 7 % of the population but also, introverted and unsociable and weak (my words) lol. You should try it!

Be happy!  You‚Äôll find it when you least expect it!

The bravest, and hardest thing you will ever have to do in this shitty ass life... is to continue your life when you want to die. 

Your mom will never, ever get over it and will probably blame herself. 

You will ruin the lives of your siblings if you have any. Their whole lives. 

I know how you feel. If I can‚Äôt do it, neither can you. 

‚ù§Ô∏è

Thank you for your kind words. I would totally believe that 10 years ago. I‚Äôm 47 now and I blinked and it‚Äôs just all gone. I haven‚Äôt begun to live,.... yet there‚Äôs no youth to build anything on anymore. Sucks üò•. It‚Äôs kind of like you said. Life consuming. 

If you are lucky enough to have mental health care in your area definitely take advantage of it. I really wish I  would‚Äôve / could.  ‚ù§Ô∏è

You just defined me too. I feel the same exact way. üò∞üò∞üò∞. Social anxiety sucks SO BAD. I know I‚Äôm not ugly and I‚Äôm funny, caring, etc...  but no one would ever know that cause I can‚Äôt hardly talk to anyone üò∞

That‚Äôs awesome you are diagnosed tho, you can work toward becoming well knowing what you have. And good for you for reaching out. I have something, no idea what but I just drank through it most my life and then I blinked and I am 47 and miserable. 

Keep reaching out!  Best of luck ‚ù§Ô∏è
Are you convinced you have BPD?  That‚Äôs a pretty hefty diagnosis!
So not ok.
